abstracts.cdata!:
The Georgia Roads Project has a
            satisfactory outcome, its sustainability is likely and a
            modest institutional development impact. The performances of
            both the Bank and the Borrower are rated satisfactory. The
            design and implementation of the project offers the
            following considerations that might be useful in shaping
            future projects of this nature: Legal covenants should be
            carefully worded to allow adequate flexibility in their
            achievement. An efficient road sector requires the
            acceptance and adoption of key principles that may be put in
            place through different mechanisms and under different types
            of administrations. Among these principles are the need to
            maintain the quality and serviceability of infrastructure
            assets through adequate funding, up to date technical
            capabilities and efficient use of scarce resources and, for
            the use of public monies, transparency and accountability.
            The design and implementation of projects in the road sector
            should give equal or more weight to the issue of quality of
            expenditures rather than to the issue of quantity of
            expenditures. Considering that quality issues involve
            substantial changes in the institutional culture which
            seldom originate within the road agency, weaknesses in those
            areas should be brought to the attention of major
            stakeholders who might have an interest in securing that the
            increased amount of funding proposed under a project is used
            wisely. Sector Policy Notes or some other form of sector
            work, could be an ideal instrument to engage the new
            government in a meaningful dialogue on sector issues and the
            role of a project (and future projects) in addressing them.
            It would provide a strategic blue print or road map for the
            sector that would help avoid costly mistakes and
            backtracking, and bring forward those areas that are
            becoming serious bottlenecks in institutional development
            (e.g. inadequate university programs, lack of career
            development incentives, etc). Engaging different
            stakeholders in a long term vision for the sector would also
            serve as a cost-effective way to raise awareness of the work
            ahead and contribute to generate well focused demand driven
            technical assistances.

5081711.majtheme: Public sector governance,Rural development,Financial and private sector development

abstracts.cdata!:
The Roads Project for Georgia has three
            aims: 1) to reduce road transport costs and improve access
            in Georgia's major traffic corridors; 2) to provide a
            steady and adequate level of funding for road maintenance
            based on charges related to road use and road access; and 3)
            to improve the management and effectiveness of the entire
            road network including local roads by strengthening the
            state road department and developing the private road
            construction industry. There are two main project
            components. The first component provides periodic
            maintenance and repair of priority sections of the main road
            network including drainage upgrading and surface treatment;
            rehabilitates section of the main road network and makes
            related improvements in shoulders, road marking, and signs;
            and reconstructs bridges. The second component strengthens
            the institutional capacity the state roads department,
            modernizes the road fund and road user charges, develops a
            traffic safety program, installs a pavement management
            system and a road data bank, updates technical
            specifications to international standards, installs a
            financial management system, improves contract management,
            plans sectoral performance indicators, sets up training, and
            funds financial audits and equipment.

repnme.cdata!:
Georgia - Road Transport Project -
            environmental assessment

abstracts.cdata!:
This is an environmental assessment for
            the Roads Transport Project for Georgia, which comprises
            urgent periodic road repair, rehabilitation, and
            reconstruction. The proposed project rating is in
            Environmental Category B. Such rehabilitation and
            maintenance projects as this, offer more efficient vehicle
            operation and a corresponding reduction in pollutant
            emissions, noise and vibrations from traffic, and the
            opportunity to offer mitigation of anticipated adverse
            impacts. Direct negative impacts in this project will arise
            from 1) producing and applying bituminous products; 2)
            quarrying stone and gravel 3) causing noise, dust, and
            traffic disruptions because of construction; and 4)
            designing and placing drains, which leads to surface
            erosion. These concerns will be addressed thus:
            Environmental guidelines will be issued to asphalt plants,
            which must meet certification requirements to receive
            project contracts. Similarly, all quarry and crushing sites
            must obtain certification and all contractors will be
            required to use materials taken only from licensed sites.
            All contractors will attend training in construction
            management and road maintenance as a prerequisite to bidding
            eligibility. Contract documents will specify that the
            contractors undertake work site mitigation actions detailed
            in the bidding documents. Drainage improvements will be
            considered in project design. Improper drainage will be
            corrected before road repairs are made.

display_title.display_title:
Georgia - Road Transport Project
            - environmental assessment (Vol. 2) : Annex
